intro: Crepis raulinii, commonly known as the Raulin's mouse-ear, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia, including parts of the Himalayas. The plant is characterized by its small, basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellow composite flowers. It thrives in alpine and arctic environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Crepis raulinii is typically found at elevations above 3,000 meters, where it adapts to cold and harsh climatic conditions.
